headline: Senate Votes Advance Infrastructure Package
summary: On Wednesday night, the U.S. Senate voted to advance a bipartisan infrastructure deal, with 17 Republicans joining all 50 Democrats in favor of taking up the bill.  The vote was 67 to 32.The Senate will begin work on the $1 trillion infrastructure plan now that a bipartisan group of Senators has agreed to take action.  It remains uncertain whether or not the bill will get the 60 votes needed to pass.
